title: Successful login with role-based access
description: Verify that a user can log in successfully with correct credentials and is granted access according to their assigned role.

steps.description: Navigate to the login page
Input valid username and password
Click the login button
Verify login is successful and session cookie is set
Verify the user interface features are accessible according to the user's role (e.g., supervisor sees dashboard, picker sees picking page)

title: Login failure with incorrect credentials
description: Verify that the login fails when an incorrect username or password is entered.

steps.description: Navigate to the login page
Input invalid username or password
Click the login button
Verify that the login fails and appropriate error message is displayed
Verify no session cookies are set

title: Role-based access control enforcement
description: Ensure that users can access only the features and pages allowed by their assigned roles (supervisors, pickers, verifiers, counter attendants).

steps.description: Log in as a picker
Attempt to access the supervisor dashboard
Verify access is denied or restricted
Log in as a supervisor
Attempt to access user management features
Verify access is allowed

title: Order status workflow from pending to finalized
description: Verify order status transitions correctly following the workflow from pending to finalized without skipping steps.

steps.description: Create a new order in pending state
Simulate picking process; update order status to 'picking in progress' and then 'picked'
Verify picked items and update status to 'verification in progress'
Finalize verification and update order status to 'finalized'
Confirm order status changes sequentially without skipping any states

title: Work unit locking prevents concurrent processing
description: Verify that once a work unit is locked by one user, another user cannot access or process the same work unit until it is unlocked or lock expires.

steps.description: Log in as picker A and lock a specific work unit
Log in as picker B and attempt to lock or access the same work unit
Verify that picker B is prevented from locking or accessing the locked work unit
Allow picker A's lock to expire or manually unlock the work unit as supervisor
Picker B attempts to lock the work unit again
Verify that picker B can now lock and process the work unit

title: Supervisor can unlock tasks forcibly
description: Verify that supervisors have the capability to forcibly unlock work units that are locked by other users.

steps.description: Log in as picker and lock a work unit
Log in as supervisor and navigate to the locked tasks list
Select the locked work unit and perform forced unlock
Verify the work unit is unlocked and available for reassignment
Log back in as picker and confirm ability to lock and process the work unit

title: Audit logs capture critical user actions
description: Ensure that all critical actions such as login, order updates, work unit locking/unlocking, and exception recording are captured in audit logs with correct user identity and timestamps.

steps.description: Perform a series of critical actions including login, order picking, verification, locking and unlocking work units, and exception recording
Verify audit logs contain entries for each action with correct user ID and accurate timestamp
Confirm audit logs reflect the nature of the action taken and changes made

title: Barcode scanning validation during picking
description: Test that the barcode scanning integration correctly validates product items during the picking process, rejecting invalid or mismatched barcodes.

steps.description: Start picking a work unit with assigned items
Scan a valid barcode corresponding to an item in the order
Verify item is accepted and marked as picked
Scan an invalid barcode not matching order items
Verify system rejects the barcode and displays an error

title: Exception recording for damaged or missing items
description: Verify that users can record exceptions like damaged, missing, or expired items during picking and verification, and these exceptions are properly logged and associated with the relevant order.

steps.description: Pick or verify an order item
Record an exception with a reason such as damaged, missing, or expired
Verify the exception is saved and associated with the order item
Ensure the exception details are visible in order history and audit logs

title: Supervisor CRUD operations on users
description: Verify that supervisors can create, update, and delete users with appropriate validation and role assignments.

steps.description: Log in as supervisor
Navigate to user management interface
Create a new user with valid details and role assignment
Verify the user is added successfully and visible in the users list
Update an existing userâ€™s details and role
Verify the user details are updated correctly
Delete a user from the system
Verify the user is removed and cannot log in

title: Concurrent locking race condition prevention
description: Test the system behavior under simultaneous lock requests for the same work unit to confirm race conditions are prevented and proper locking is enforced.

steps.description: Simultaneously issue locking requests on the same work unit from two different users
Verify only one user successfully locks the work unit
Verify the other user receives an appropriate message indicating the work unit is locked

title: Mobile interface performance responsiveness
description: Verify that the mobile-optimized interface is responsive and performant during essential workflows like picking, verification, and exception recording.

steps.description: Access the picking interface from a mobile device
Navigate through picking, scanning barcode, and recording exception steps
Verify UI elements load promptly and user interactions respond within acceptable time thresholds

title: Desktop interface task management function validation
description: Verify that the desktop interface for supervisors and other roles correctly supports order management, user management, and unlocking functionalities.

steps.description: Log in to the desktop interface as a supervisor
Create and assign new orders
Unlock locked tasks as needed
Manage users via CRUD operations
Verify all features operate correctly and UI updates reflect changes instantly
